title: Business Director
content:
Media.Monks is looking for an ambitious Business Director to lead this top-name strategic and creative FMCG account. In this lead client-facing position, you’ll work at the intersection of business and production to bring world-class creative to fruition.
Role & Responsibilities

You will be highly strategic in your thinking, not only in how you respond to briefs and manage the team but in working with c-suite clients who are looking for problem solving solutions through digital innovation and capabilities. You will have a high level of EQ and will be able to nurture your business relationships at a senior level. 
Working as part of our Media.Monks London team, you’ll be wearing multiple hats at once as part of a long-term creative partnership delivering best-in-class content production work that is executed on a global level.
You’re chiefly responsible for one main client, overseeing the work we do for all of its brands.
You act as a strategic partner throughout who understands the client’s brand and business inside out, developing a roadmap for continued success.
You’ll be leading a team focussing on strategic recommendations, championing best-in-class creative, and overseeing 360 campaign delivery.
You will be viewed as the core lead on the team internally and will be responsible for focusing and directing a team of up to 20 across multiple disciplines.
You will be the owner of Procurement relationships and senior Brand relationships, able to manage at Director and VP level. You will be the first point of contact for new briefs and dealing with escalation.
You oversee the program of projects (in partnership with a delivery lead) liaising between the client and our own Monks to kickstart new assignments, delegating tasks to dedicated teams.
You will be a digital native and expert in platforms, social and asset production and be able to direct any type of client ask.
You’ll not just be our client’s go-to Monk: as a Business Monk you’re responsible for orchestrating the entire sales pipeline as well as overseeing the successful growth of the individual brands that sit within your client’s jurisdiction.
Safeguarding revenue growth, you look after business planning and development to make sure we hit targets and KPIs, identifying growth opportunities for new assignments that add value to all parties.

 
Requirements:

This senior-level role requires someone who’s experienced in managing multi-million pound retainers.
With ideally around 8 years of industry experience and 2+ years in a lead role, you have a proven track record managing high-value and volumes of interdisciplinary work.
You are an incredible relationship builder and have proven experience in working with the biggest advertisers in the world.
You bring a broad understanding of what is needed to produce high-end content at a high pace in today’s always-on environment.
You have a proven track record of winning business and building teams. There is a big growth opportunity within this client and an entrepreneurial mindset is a must have.
You don’t think in projects but in partnerships, developing the client relationship and work-streams milestones ahead.
You will have a background in FMCG digital marketing and online advertising and have a strong rap sheet of experience in a similar type of client engagement.
About Media.Monks:
Media.Monks is the purely digital operating brand of S4Capital plc that connects 8,600+ digital natives across one global team. We are united by a mission to shift industries forward and pave the path towards ambitious outcomes so our clients and our people can realize their full potential for growth. Our unified model combines solutions in media, data, social, platforms, studio, experience, brand and technology services to help our clients continuously reinvent themselves throughout increasingly rapid cycles of disruption. Our efforts to shape culture, build innovative technologies and unlock the future of growth have earned recognition from numerous esteemed panels: we maintain a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-22), regular recognition at Cannes Lions, inclusion in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players (2020-23), the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-23), a record number of FWAs, and have earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023. Together, these achievements solidify our experience in digital innovation, excellence in craft, and commitment to personal growth.
While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Media.Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://media.monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.

We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission. 

As a step in strengthening our hiring process, we invite you to voluntarily provide information that will help inform and improve our inclusion efforts.
